ground_truth: Ferris pulls himself free and clambers over the wall. He makes a call as he limps across wasteland. Skip parks the BMW on a busy street, and he and Ferris get out. They walk into a health clinic. In a treatment room, Ferris sits up on a bed. A doctor attends to him. The doctor leaves, and the pretty young nurse, Aisha, walks in. She gets a packet from a cabinet and goes to Ferris. She looks at the deep, bloody bites on Ferris' leg. She looks at his bloody hands and cut arm. He smiles, and she prepares a syringe. She walks around to him, smiling. Ferris studies her as she holds up the syringe and flicks it. He winces as she injects him in the stomach. He calls Hoffman. Hoffman gets in his car next to his daughter. Two men in suits open gates, and the Mercedes drives into a courtyard. It stops behind another car which Hani is leaning against, smoking. Ferris gets out of the Mercedes looking a little apprehensive. He walks up to Hani. He throws his cigarette away. Hani leads Ferris along a corridor. Hani goes to a door with a window in it and knocks on the glass. On the other side, a man lowers a flap, and Ferris looks into the room. Hoffman's agent, Zayed Ibishi, is naked and tied down on a table. A man whips him. Ferris turns away. Ferris watches the flogging, his eyes narrowed. A young man wearing a black kufi wheels a bicycle with heavily laden panniers out onto a street. He stops by some bins, lifts the lid of one of them, and takes out two paper cups. He takes a piece of paper from one of the cups. The young man wheels his bicycle away. Noordermarkt. A bustling, covered marketplace. People are crowded in the street and around flower stalls. A young man with his black hair swept back locks a car, then notices a tourist lining up a photograph. Head down, the man briskly walks past the tourist, pressing the keys of a mobile phone. The car explodes, sending shock waves through the marketplace. Black and white frame-by-frame images of the explosion, which is blanked out by static. Smoke hangs over the marketplace. Ferris, in his apartment, and Hani, at home with his wife, watch the news. Al-Saleem watches the report. Ferris meets Marwan. Ferris looks at Hani, who's sitting in his car. Ferris sits in the back next to Hani, and Marwan shuts the door. They drive across the desert in a convoy of black cars. The photos Ferris showed Hani. On a vast expanse of brown earth, a suited man stands beside a kneeling figure, whose head is covered with a black hood.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Ferris, with a determined struggle, manages to pull himself free from his current predicament and painstakingly clambers over the nearby wall. As he limps across the desolate wasteland, filled with debris and scattered trash, he makes an important phone call. Meanwhile, Skip arrives and strategically parks the shiny BMW on a bustling, crowded street. Both Ferris and Skip exit the car and proceed to walk purposefully into a health clinic. Once inside, Ferris finds himself in a treatment room, where he gingerly sits up on a bed, waiting for medical attention. A diligent doctor is currently attending to Ferris, offering him the necessary care. After the doctor has completed his duties and leaves the room, a pretty young nurse named Aisha enters with a warm, friendly demeanor. She retrieves a packet from a cabinet filled with medical supplies and approaches Ferris. With a concerned expression, she examines the deep, bloody bites on his injured leg, and her eyes move over his bloody hands and the cuts on his arm. Despite his injuries, Ferris offers a reassuring smile. Aisha prepares a syringe with meticulous care, walking around the bed to reach him and maintaining her smile. Ferris closely observes her as she expertly holds up the syringe, gives it a little flick to remove any air bubbles, and prepares to inject him. He winces slightly when she administers the injection directly into his stomach. After the injection, Ferris makes a call to Hoffman. At the same time, Hoffman gets into his car, settling next to his daughter. As their car moves, two men dressed in suits open large gates, allowing the Mercedes to drive into a private courtyard. It comes to a stop behind another vehicle where Hani stands, casually leaning and smoking a cigarette. Ferris gets out of the Mercedes, appearing somewhat apprehensive. He approaches Hani, who nonchalantly tosses his cigarette aside. Hani then leads Ferris down a long corridor, and they arrive at a door with a small window. Hani knocks on the glass. On the other side, a man lowers a small flap, and Ferris peers into the room. Inside, Hoffman's agent, Zayed Ibishi, is seen to be completely naked and restrained on a table, suffering as a man mercilessly whips him. Ferris turns away but cannot help but continue watching the flogging, his eyes narrowing in response to the sight before him. Elsewhere, a young man wearing a black kufi wheels a bicycle that is heavily laden with panniers out onto an active street. He pauses by some bins, lifting the lid of one, and retrieves two paper cups. He carefully takes a piece of paper from one of the cups and then continues on his way, wheeling his bicycle away from the scene. In Noordermarkt, a bustling and busy covered marketplace, people crowd the streets, surrounded by vibrant flower stalls. A young man with sharply swept-back black hair locks his car, his attention caught by a tourist who is lining up a photograph. Keeping his head down, the man briskly walks past the tourist while pressing the keys of a mobile phone. Suddenly, the car explodes, sending shock waves through the entire marketplace. The explosion is captured in stark black and white, frame by frame, images blanked out by static as smoke ominously hangs over the chaotic scene. In his apartment, Ferris watches the breaking news on television, while Hani is at home with his wife doing the same. Al-Saleem also views the news report with interest. Later, Ferris meets with Marwan. During the meeting, Ferris glances at Hani, who is seated in his car. Ferris joins him by sitting in the back seat next to Hani, and Marwan efficiently closes the car door. They drive across the vast, expansive desert as part of a convoy of sleek black cars. The photos that Ferris had shown to Hani earlier come to mind. On this expanse of brown earth, a suited man is standing beside a kneeling figure, whose head is completely covered by a black hood, creating a stark and somber scene.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Kendra wiggles herself loose and hops over the fence. She sends a message as she strolls across a meadow. Jasper docks the sailboat in a crowded harbor, and he and Kendra disembark. They wander into an art gallery. In an exhibit hall, Kendra lies back on a lounge chair. An artist examines her. The artist departs, and the charming ancient caretaker, Layla, enters. She retrieves a canvas from a shelf and approaches Kendra. She observes the intricate, colorful markers on Kendra's arm. She examines her painted nails and decorated wrist. He chuckles, and she sets up an easel. She meanders around to him, chuckling. Kendra observes her as she holds up a brush and strokes it. He grimaces as she paints on his shoulder. He contacts Winslow. Winslow boards his bike next to his son. Two engineers in overalls swing open barriers, and the limousine rolls into a garage. It halts behind another vehicle which Tariq is reclining against, sipping. Kendra steps out of the limousine appearing a bit nervous. She strides up to Tariq. He flicks his drink away. Tariq guides Kendra down a passage. Tariq approaches a curtain with a peephole in it and taps on the glass. On the opposite side, an assistant drops a shutter, and Kendra peers into the chamber. Winslow's messenger, Mohsin Khalid, is unclothed and strapped to a chair. An instructor slaps him. Kendra averts her gaze. Kendra observes the disciplining, her gaze steely. A teenager wearing a blue beanie pedals a tricycle with heavily burdened baskets onto an avenue. He pauses by some barrels, lifts the cover of one of them, and retrieves two ceramic jars. He removes a scroll from one of the jars. The teenager pedals his tricycle away. Grand Square. A lively, enclosed bazaar. Visitors are thronged in the alleyway and around fruit stalls. A teenager with his curly hair tied up secures a scooter, then notices a traveler framing a sketch. Chin down, the youth promptly moves past the traveler, tapping the buttons of a smartwatch. The scooter detonates, sending waves of noise through the bazaar. Grayscale still shots of the detonation, which is obscured by interference. Mist lingers over the bazaar. Kendra, in her office, and Tariq, at home with his sister, view the broadcast. Al-Mansur observes the announcement. Kendra consults with Omar. Kendra glances at Tariq, who's stationed in his van. Kendra nestles in the rear beside Tariq, and Omar closes the hatch. They traverse the savannah in a fleet of white vans. The sketches Kendra displayed to Tariq. On an expansive stretch of golden sand, a robed figure stands beside a crouching silhouette, whose face is masked with a red scarf.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Ferris, injured and limping, calls for help while traversing a wasteland. He meets Skip, and they head to a health clinic, where a nurse named Aisha treats Ferris's wounds. After a brief conversation with Hoffman, Ferris arrives in a Mercedes at a courtyard where Hani waits. Hani leads Ferris to witness a disturbing scene where Hoffman's agent, Zayed Ibishi, is tortured. Meanwhile, a young man with a bicycle retrieves a note from a bin and later triggers a car explosion in a crowded marketplace, causing chaos and shock. As Ferris and Hani watch the news of the explosion, Ferris later meets with Marwan. He and Hani drive across the desert with Ferris carrying photos showing a suited man beside a hooded, kneeling figure on a vast expanse of land.
